intro: Manihot mossamedensis, commonly known as the Brazilian arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are rich in starch. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has heart-shaped leaves with a smooth surface. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-yellow in color. The tubers are used as a food source and have a mild, starchy flavor similar to yams.
